information:
The middleweight bout between Joe Pyfer and Kelvin Gastelum is scheduled for the main card of UFC 316, which will take place on June 7, 2025, at the Prudential Center in Newark, New Jersey. This is a rebooked fight, originally scheduled for UFC Mexico on March 29 before being cancelled. According to UFCStats 'tale of the tape' data, Pyfer has a slight grappling and reach advantage, while Gastelum fights from a southpaw stance.

Joe Pyfer has won six of his last seven professional fights, holding a 4-1 record within the UFC. His most recent victory was a first-round knockout of Marc-Andre Barriault at UFC 303, which earned him a Performance of the Night bonus. Pyfer had to withdraw from the originally scheduled fight against Gastelum in Mexico due to an illness.

Kelvin Gastelum is a veteran fighter and the winner of 'The Ultimate Fighter 17'. The fight at UFC 316 will mark his 24th appearance in the UFC Octagon. He has won two of his last three fights, with his most recent competition being a unanimous decision victory over Daniel Rodriguez in June 2024 at UFC Saudi Arabia.

forecast.time_left_until_outcome_known: 12 days - UFC 316 is scheduled for June 7, 2025, and today is May 26, 2025
forecast.status_quo_outcome: Joe Pyfer fights Kelvin Gastelum at UFC 316 as scheduled
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Pyfer or Gastelum withdraws due to injury/illness in the next 12 days, the fight is cancelled, or Pyfer fights but loses to Gastelum via knockout, submission, or decision
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: Pyfer defeats Gastelum (or a potential late replacement opponent) at UFC 316 via knockout, submission, or decision
forecast.rationale: With 12 days until the event, the fight is confirmed and on the main card at Prudential Center in Newark. The primary risks are: (1) the fight doesn't happen, and (2) Pyfer loses if it does happen. Fight cancellation risk is relatively low given the proximity to the event and that both fighters appear healthy - Pyfer recovered from his illness that caused the Mexico withdrawal. I estimate ~87% probability the fight happens. For the fight outcome, Pyfer shows strong recent form (6-1 in last 7, recent KO victory with bonus, 4-1 UFC record) and has physical advantages (reach, grappling) per the tale of the tape. However, Gastelum is a highly experienced UFC veteran (24th UFC appearance, TUF 17 winner) fighting his 3rd fight in recent return to form (2-1 in last 3). Gastelum's southpaw stance and experience are real challenges. Pyfer fighting near home in New Jersey may provide a small advantage. I estimate Pyfer has approximately 60% chance of winning if the fight happens, factoring in his momentum against Gastelum's experience. Combined probability: 0.87 × 0.60 ≈ 52%, with small additional chance (~2%) of a late replacement opponent who Pyfer might have better odds against. My forecast would increase if Pyfer showed dominant form in pre-fight media or if Gastelum showed signs of decline. It would decrease if injury concerns emerged or if fight metrics showed Gastelum as a significant favorite.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Joe Pyfer defeat someone at UFC 316?

Question background:
Sports Illustrated: [UFC 316 adds rebooked fight after last-minute Mexico cancellation](https://www.si.com/fannation/mma/news/ufc-316-rebooked-fight-kelvin-gastelum-joe-pyfer-mexico-cancellation)


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if Joe Pyfer defeats someone at [UFC 316](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFC_316).

If Pyfer does not fight anyone at UFC 316, this resolves as No.


Your research assistant's report says:
The middleweight bout between Joe Pyfer and Kelvin Gastelum is scheduled for the main card of UFC 316, which will take place on June 7, 2025, at the Prudential Center in Newark, New Jersey. This is a rebooked fight, originally scheduled for UFC Mexico on March 29 before being cancelled. According to UFCStats 'tale of the tape' data, Pyfer has a slight grappling and reach advantage, while Gastelum fights from a southpaw stance.

Joe Pyfer has won six of his last seven professional fights, holding a 4-1 record within the UFC. His most recent victory was a first-round knockout of Marc-Andre Barriault at UFC 303, which earned him a Performance of the Night bonus. Pyfer had to withdraw from the originally scheduled fight against Gastelum in Mexico due to an illness.

Kelvin Gastelum is a veteran fighter and the winner of 'The Ultimate Fighter 17'. The fight at UFC 316 will mark his 24th appearance in the UFC Octagon. He has won two of his last three fights, with his most recent competition being a unanimous decision victory over Daniel Rodriguez in June 2024 at UFC Saudi Arabia.

Today is 2025-05-26.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
